climbs.name: Vaccinate
climbs.fa: FA Jamie Roper March 2021.  Bolted by Matt Markell

content.description: The usual fun, easy climbing down low leads you up the buttress left of the large hole.  As the rock gets steeper and higher quality continue onto the face using the left crack and great pockets to reach the anchor.  Fun stem moves also possible here on features.  If only this were 30m!
content.protection: Glue In Bolts,  Steel Lower off
content.location: Far left of Buda where there are a series of broken block and vertical cracks/ flakes.  A Cat Claw stump is hidden in the crack.

content.description:
More exploration and cleaning yields good returns! 

  Cracked Teeth is on the left side of Buda Belly wall proper, just left of Breezy.  Climb up some easy ledges to the base of a small, shallow corner.  Clip the first bolt on the right face and then make fun moves, pulling on the crack and pockets on the face to a stance.  Clip the 2nd bolt and climb easy terrain up the "plates" past a 3rd bolt, heading to the base of the broken looking crack and corner looming above.  From the ledge, clip the 4th bolt and then climb up the broken corner and left face arching leftward past 3 more bolts (7 total).  Lower from the chains.
content.protection: 7 Bolts plus chains at the anchor.
content.location: The left side of Buda Belly just left of Breezy.  Look for a shallow corner with a bolt about 8 feet up on the right face.  The bulk of the climb will be obvious above.  Look for the broken looking corner above.

content.description:
Climbs up between Holy Moley and Bullet the Gray Sky into the right leaning ramped corned near the top.

 Should clean up to be a nice "entry level" route.
content.protection:
Top Rope Anchors  

  Lead bolt to follow once cleaned.

content.description: Climb the lower angle rock through pockets and good holds to the ledge.  Climb up to the base of the bulge  aiming to be below the lowest part of the downward facing triangle of rock above.  Climb up to the bulge and surmount it moving a bit right as you do.  Turn the bulge onto lower angle rock and climb the right facing corner crack and face to the anchors.

Start left of the prominent block/arete on the far left of Buda.  Look for a lower angle ramp just above a large, horizontal gap.  Climb up the ramp/corner past one bolt onto the ledge below a slightly right slanting crack.  Follow the crack past large pockets and a bolt to the base of the headwall right of the large hole around mid-height.  Move up onto the head wall using a shallow flake that curves up and left.  Continue up, following the arete after  the flake end following pockets to the top.Steel Biner Anchors

climbs.name: Holey Moley
climbs.fa: TR: Unknown / Bolted by Blake / Restoration Bolting TCC

content.description: Climbs up cool looking swiss cheese rock left of the darker water streak. Start on the far left side of Buda Belly. Look for a light facing corner/crack and climb this past one bolt onto the ledge. Climb up a clean slab with some nice holesk past one bolt heading for the base of the obvious, dark pocketed wall above. Make some moves in the blocky corner to clip the first bolt on the headwall and then climb up great pockets past two more bolts to the anchor generally staying out of the brownish, dirtier rock on your right.Steel Biners for anchor.
content.protection: bolts to a Mussy Hook Anchor
content.location: Left of the main Buda Belly Wall on a prominent arete with dark pocketed rock on the right side.

content.description: Climb the lower slab after making a strenuous mantle head up easier terrain onto a ledge below the major bulge above.  The route climbs up through the steepest part in a white streak.  Pull over the lip trending right towards a downward facing flake before moving over a smaller bulge onto easier terrain and the anchor.

Head straight up the main slab past the left pair of 2 bolts. At the ledge, clip a bolt up and left and follow pockets up and slightly left past a bolt near the "golf ball" hold. Move up past the bulge and punch it to the top past the final boltsVariation #1. "Way of the Ninja"  Rather than moving directly up off the golf ball, one can move hard left horizontally to a jug on the the far right of the Brizzy ledge and then punch up into the corner from there.  Finish as normal.  FA - Leck Null ~2008.
content.protection:
Bolts 

  Chains with Steel Biners for Lowering.

climbs.name: Dirty Hands
climbs.fa: FA - Jamie Roper / Bolted By Matt Markell March 2021

content.description: Scramble up the ramps to the shallow, left facing corner.  Pull a move or two onto the upper, low slabs and scramble up to the blocky left facing rock.  Pull on large holds to gain the upper, steeper rock.  A few slightly harder moves gets you onto the main wall.  Pull final moves to step left into a corner and clip the anchor.
content.protection: Glue In Bolts, Steel Lower Off Anchor
content.location: Left most route on Buda before the break in the upper wall where it changes over to Petri Dish.  Starts on ramps up to a short, shallow left facing corner.

content.description: It’s a good crack for practicing on. I was able to use two hand jams(unable to see in the photo from this angle) till I got my foot placement. Topping out can be tricky as there is a lot of loose rock and leaves at the top as well as low hanging tree branches. Be ware of the loose stones inside the crack that appear to be solidly attached.
content.location: To the far right of the Malpractice Section of the Medicine Wall.

content.description: Climb up the lower slab on fun, large holds aiming for the obvious corner above.  Surmount some stepped rock to the base of the corner before making the crux moves.  Finish on nice edges up the corner to the anchor out right.

Begin 6 feet left of Two Cracked Teeth.  Scramble up stepped, low angle rock to the first steep rock.  Clip the 1st bolt and then make a few moves to pull up onto the first ledge system.  Climb easy rock past a 2nd bolt into a upward slanting left to right ramp behind the large flake.  Scramble up the ramp and face to the base of the left Arete to find the 3rd bolt.  Climb up and onto the Arete proper pulling pockets and edges up the Arete past 3 glue ins.  Finish at "Two Cracked" Teeth anchor. 

  The gunshot heard in the morning combined with the cloudy day and the Arete gave this one it's name (a play on another famous route)
content.location:
Climbs the Arete left of Two Cracked Teeth. 

  Lower From Hooks

content.description:
Scramble up so low angle rock to start at a the base of a small, right facing corner/flake.  Clip the 1st bolt and than pull up onto the ledge.  Climb up easier terrain past 2 more bolts on the slab to the main ledge system below a chain draw.  Clip the chain draw and make powerful moves up the "Fins"  until you're below the main bulge.  This is the Buda Belly I think.  Climb up and left past a bolt in the roof onto the pocketed face above the roof.  Clip one more bolt as you move up and right to the anchor.  Fun!   

  Note: The belayer should be attentive and minimize slack in the rope as the leader makes their way up the "Fins" and especially when clipping the bolt in the roof (Belly).  A fall there with a crappy belay will land you on the ledge.
content.protection:
Bolts for Pro 

  Mussy Hook Anchor
content.location: Left of Fear of Flying on the left side of the Main part of Buda Belly

content.description: The first major outcrop of rock you encounter as you hike along the creek bed.  Look for the "bulge" mid-way up the rock.
